title: Low-Carb Lemon-Chicken Piccata
description: A bright, tangy low-carb take on classic chicken piccata featuring pan-seared chicken cutlets finished in a lemon-caper butter sauce. Quick to make, high in protein, and suitable for low-carb and keto meal plans without sacrificing restaurant-style flavor.

ingredients.display_name: boneless skinless chicken breasts (halved horizontally into cutlets)
ingredients.notes: trim and halve each breast to form 6-8 thin cutlets (about 4 cutlets per lb depending on size)
finely ground blanched almond flour for low-carb crust
divided (use salted if preferred and reduce added salt)
or use dry white wine for a more classic flavor (same volume)

ingredients.display_name: heavy cream (optional, for a slightly richer sauce)
ingredients.notes: omit for strict keto/low-calorie version or to keep brighter lemon flavor

steps.text: Prepare chicken: pat cutlets dry and season both sides with salt and pepper, set a shallow bowl with beaten eggs and another with almond flour mixed with grated parmesan for dredging.
Dredge each cutlet first in the egg wash, letting excess drip off, then press into the almond flour-parmesan mixture to coat evenly; place on a tray while heating the pan.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat, add olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter. When butter foams, add chicken cutlets in a single layer without crowding and sear until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side depending on thickness; work in batches if necessary. Transfer cooked cutlets to a warm plate and tent with foil.
Reduce heat to medium, add remaining butter to the skillet, then sauté minced garlic briefly until fragrant but not browned (about 30 seconds).
Deglaze the pan with chicken broth (or white wine) scraping up browned bits, then add lemon juice and drained capers; simmer and reduce the sauce for 2–3 minutes to concentrate flavor.

If using, stir in heavy cream and simmer 1 minute to bind the sauce; return chicken and any accumulated juices to the skillet and spoon sauce over to rewarm and finish cooking through for 1–2 minutes until internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Remove from heat, stir in chopped parsley, adjust seasoning to taste, and serve chicken topped with pan sauce and lemon slices.
